EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  9.01
	 
TO:                               Board of Trustees
	 
FROM:                          Dan Moser, Superintendent
	 
SUBJECT:                    Consideration and Adoption, Rejection or Modification of May 4, 2011 Proposed
                                    Decision of Administrative Law Judge Regarding Reduction in Particular Kinds of Service
                                    (Office of Administrative Hearings Case No. 2011030109)
	 
	 
Attached is the Proposed Decision of the Administrative Law Judge regarding the Reduction in Particular Kinds of Service.  Administration is recommending that the Board adopt the May 4, 2011, Proposed Decision of the Administrative Law Judge regarding the Reduction in Particular Kinds of Service (Office of Administrative Hearings Case No. 2011030109).
	 
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board adopt the May 4, 2011 Proposed Decision of the Administrative Law Judge regarding the Reduction in Particular Kinds of Service (Office of Administrative Hearings Case No. 2011030109).

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  9.02
	 
TO:                               Board of Trustees
	 
FROM:                          Dan Moser, Superintendent
	 
SUBJECT:                    Accept Superintendent’s Recommendation to Dismiss Employees Due to Reduction 
                                    in Particular Kinds of Service and Direct Superintendent to Issue Final Termination 
                                    Notices in Accordance with the Board’s Certificated Layoff Decision and the
                                    Requirements of the Education Code 
	 
	 
On March 10, 2011, I recommended to the Governing Board that it not reemploy 18 certificated personnel for the 2011-2012 school year and that the Board give them notice as required by Education Code sections 44949 and 44955 that their services will not be required.
	 
I now hereby recommend to the Governing Board that it not reemploy the following certificated personnel for the 2011-2012 school year and that the Board give the notice as required by Education Code sections 44949 and 44955 that their services will not be required.
	 
Esther Diaz-Martin - Spanish
Tersie Ndon - Child Development
Nichole Piazza - Social Science
	 
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the certificated non reemployment list for the 
2011-2012 school year.

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  9.03
	 
	 
TO:                               Board of Trustees
	 
FROM:                          Dan Moser, Superintendent
	 
PREPARED BY:            Catherine A. Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction;
                                    and Vida Branner, Director of Compensation and Classified Employee Relations
	 
SUBJECT:                    Hold Public Hearing at Approximately 6:20 p.m.
                                    Regarding Tentative Successor Agreement with California School
                                    Employees Association, Chapter 187, July 1, 2010 – June 30, 2013, and Disclosure of 
                                    Major Provisions of Tentative Agreement (AB1200)
	 
	 
In accordance with Assembly Bill 1200 requiring school districts to disclose, at a public meeting, the cost that would be incurred by the implementation of a collective bargaining agreement.  In meeting the requirement, a public hearing is being held to give our community an opportunity to comment on the cost of this tentative agreement.
	 
Attached is a copy of the proposed changes to the collective bargaining agreement with the California School Employees Association, Chapter 187, July 1, 2010 - June 30, 2013.  The District and the California School Employees Association, Chapter 187, reached a tentative agreement on April 15, 2011.  The tentative agreement was ratified by California School Employees Association, Chapter 187, on April 20, 2011.
	 
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
Administration recommends that the Board accept any comment on the proposed Tentative Agreement with the California School Employees Association, Chapter 187, July 1, 2010 – June 30, 2013.
items.item_text: Hold Public Hearing at Approximately 6:20 p.m. - Regarding Tentative Successor Agreement with California School Employees Association, Chapter 187, July 1, 2010 - June 30, 2013, and Disclosure of Major Provisions of Tentative Agreement (AB1200) - Dan Moser, Superintendent; Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction; and Vida Branner, Director of Compensation and Classified Employee Relations
items.item_text_raw: 9.03 Hold Public Hearing at Approximately 6:20 p.m. - Regarding Tentative Successor Agreement with California School Employees Association, Chapter 187, July 1, 2010 - June 30, 2013, and Disclosure of Major Provisions of Tentative Agreement (AB1200) - Dan Moser, Superintendent; Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction; and Vida Branner, Director of Compensation and Classified Employee Relations

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  9.04
	 
	 
TO:                               Board of Trustees
	 
FROM:                          Dan Moser, Superintendent
	 
PREPARED BY:            Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction;
                                    and Vida Branner, Director of Compensation and Classified Employee Relations
	 
SUBJECT:                    Ratify and Approve Tentative Agreement with the California School Employees  
                                    Association, Chapter 187, July 1, 2010 – June 30, 2013
	 
	 
Attached is a copy of the proposed changes to the collective bargaining agreement with the California School Employees Association, Chapter 187, July 1, 2010 - June 30, 2013.  The District and the California School Employees Association, Chapter 187 reached a tentative agreement on April 15, 2011.  The tentative agreement was ratified by the California School Employees Association, Chapter 187, on April 20, 2011.  We are submitting this agreement to the Board of Trustees for approval.
	 
In addition, provisions of AB1200 require that school districts disclose, at a public meeting, the cost that would be incurred by the implementation of a collective bargaining agreement.  In meeting the requirement, a public hearing was held to give our community an opportunity to comment on the cost of this tentative agreement.
	 
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
As per attached AB1200 document
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
General, Special Education, and Adult Education Funds
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees, per compliance with AB1200, ratify the tentative agreement between the East Side Union High School District and the California School Employees Association, Chapter 187, July 1, 2010 - June 30, 2013.
items.item_text: Ratify and Approve Tentative Agreement with the California School Employees Association, Chapter 187, July 1, 2010 - June 30, 2013 - Dan Moser, Superintendent; Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction; and Vida Branner, Director of Compensation and Classified Employee Relations
items.item_text_raw: 9.04 Ratify and Approve Tentative Agreement with the California School Employees Association, Chapter 187, July 1, 2010 - June 30, 2013 - Dan Moser, Superintendent; Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction; and Vida Branner, Director of Compensation and Classified Employee Relations

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  9.05
	 
TO:                               Board of Trustees
	 
FROM:                          Dan Moser, Superintendent
	 
PREPARED BY:            Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction; and
                                    Vida Branner, Director of Compensation and Classified Employee Relations 
	 
SUBJECT:                    Hold Public Hearing at Approximately 6:30 p.m.
                                    Proposed Adoption of the Initial Proposal for Successor Contract: From East Side Union
                                    High School District to California School Employees Association, Chapter 187
	 
	 
The East Side Union High School District presents the following re-opening and initial proposal to the California School Employees Association, Chapter 187 for the 2011-2012 school year.  Pursuant to Government Code §3547 the District’s initial proposal must be presented to the public in open session at a public meeting.
	 
The District continues to acknowledge and appreciate the contributions made to its mission and programs by its classified employees, and continues to seek the utilization of equitable and collaborative methods of addressing the needs of the students, parents and employees of the East Side Union High School District.  
	 
The District continues to experience severe financial constraints arising from a variety of factors.  The District views financial issues in the context of keeping the District solvent, restoring and maintaining the legally required reserves, and preserving the quality education for the students of the District.  Given the above, the District proposes to open/re-open the following areas for negotiations: Adjustments/reductions in total compensation which includes salary and benefits; reduction of work year and work day; and reduction of chapter release time.
	 
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Various
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
To be negotiated
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
Administration recommends that the Board sunshine and accept any comment on, and adopt, the District’s initial proposal to the Classified Employee Association, Chapter 187.
items.item_text: Hold Public Hearing at Approximately 6:30 p.m. - Proposed Adoption of the Initial Proposal for Successor Contract: From East Side Union High School District to California School Employees Association, Chapter 187 - Dan Moser, Superintendent; Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction; and Vida Branner, Director of Compensation and Classified Employee Relations
items.item_text_raw: 9.05 Hold Public Hearing at Approximately 6:30 p.m. - Proposed Adoption of the Initial Proposal for Successor Contract: From East Side Union High School District to California School Employees Association, Chapter 187 - Dan Moser, Superintendent; Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction; and Vida Branner, Director of Compensation and Classified Employee Relations

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  9.07 
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM: 
Dan Moser, Superintendent
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Discussion and/or Action to Nominate 2011 Outstanding Legislator of the Year and Adoption of Resolution #2010-2011-41
	 
	 
The California School Boards Association (CSBA) is accepting nominations for the 2011 Outstanding Legislator of the Year. Each year, CSBA honors two (2) to four (4) current members of the State Senate and Assembly who work actively to improve our public schools who exercise leadership in the legislative arena. 
Nominations for the 2011 CSBA Outstanding Legislator of the Year must be submitted to the California School Boards Association and postmarked, faxed or completed online no later than September 2, 2011. 
The final selection of honorees will be made in September 2011. The awards will be presented at the 2011 CSBA Annual Education Conference in December 2011. 
	 
	 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
Not Applicable
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Not  Applicable
 RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees nominate a Senator and/or Assembly Member for CSBA's 2011 Outstanding Legislator of the Year and also adopt Resolution #2010/2011-41 Nomination(s) for 2011 Outstanding Legislator of the Year to the California School Board Association (CSBA).
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
East Side Union High School District 
of 
Santa Clara County, State of California 
RESOLUTION #2010/2011-41
Nomination(s) for 2011 Outstanding Legislator of the Year 
to the California School Boards Association (CSBA)
	 
WHEREAS, ______________________demonstrates significant commitment and legislative contributions to public education;
WHEREAS, _____________________demonstrates legislative leadership on behalf of public education;
WHEREAS, _____________________recognizes and supports local governance for schools;
WHEREAS, _____________________ supports key K-12 legislative proposals;
WHEREAS, ____________________supports and espouses CSBA’s Legislative Platform;
WHEREAS, _____________________ recognizes the significance of CSBA’s role in public education;
WHEREAS, _____________________ is active on local school issues and visits K-12 schools regularly;
WHEREAS, ___________________is a member of the California State Legislature at the time of nomination;
WHEREAS, _____________________ represents the East Side Union High School District.
THEREFORE BE IT RESOLVED, by the East Side Union High School District that _________________ be nominated as CSBA’s 2011 Legislator of the Year.
PASSED AND ADOPTED this 10th day of May 2011 by the Governing Board of the East Side Union High School District at its regular meeting held at 830 N. Capitol Avenue, San Jose, State of California.
	AYES: ________
	NOES: ________
	ABSENT: ________
	 
ABSTENTIONS: ________
	I certify that the foregoing resolution was duly introduced, passed, and adopted by the East Side Union High School District Board of Trustees at a meeting held on May 10th, 2011.
	___________________________________________
	Van Le, Clerk
	ESUHSD Board of Trustees
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended that the Board of Trustees nominate a Senator and/or Assembly Member for CSBA's 2011 Outstanding Legislator of the Year and also adopt Resolution #2010/2011-41 Nomination(s) for 2011 Outstanding Legislator of the Year to the California School Board Association (CSBA).

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  9.08
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Superintendent
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Nomination of 2012 CSBA President-Elect and/or CSBA Vice President
	 
	 
	 
CSBA is currently accepting nominations for 2012 CSBA President-elect and Vice President. 
	 
	 
Potential/qualified candidates must:
Serve on a school district or county board that is a member of CSBA.
Receive a minimum of three (3) nominations. (Nominations may be made by either a governing board/county board that is a member of CSBA or an individual board member whose board is a member of CSBA.)
Have an understanding of the vision and mission of CSBA, the governance role of officers of a nonprofit board, and be able to demonstrate experience and knowledge of education issues.
	 
Nominations must be received by 5:00 PM on Monday, June 6, 2011.
	 
	 
Critical information:  
Nominations for CSBA President-elect and/or Vice President must be submitted by any governing board belonging to CSBA or any individual board member whose board is a member of CSBA; either will be considered as one nomination. Three nomination forms are required for candidacy.
	 
	 
	 
	 
Recommendation:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees nominate a 2012 CSBA President-elect and/or CSBA Vice President.
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended that the Board of Trustees nominate a 2012 CSBA President-elect and/or CSBA Vice President.

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  10.01
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction, Carole Hersom, Coordinator of Special Services, and Rich Uribe, Coordinator of Special Services
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Special Education Compliance and Oversight Plan Progress Presentation 
	 
	 
2007-08 Special Education Verification Review (VR) Special Conditions
	 
This report created in coordination with the South East Special Education Local Plan Area (SELPA) is required due to the findings from each of the California Department of Education (CDE) verification review visits which were comprehensive, thorough and analytical evaluations of the district’s special education programs and services.
	 
The following areas will be addressed in the Board presentation:
Progress to date related to findings of noncompliance during the  Verification Review and follow up visits
Findings of noncompliance related to complaint investigations
Development of a written oversight plan to include monitoring for compliance as it relates to IEP implementation, IEP components, IEP team members, IEP timelines, assessment timelines and parent notification
The end result will ensure the East Side Union High School District will remain in compliance with state and federal law.
items.item_text: Special Education Compliance and Oversight Plan Progress Presentation - Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction, Carole Hersom, Coordinator of Special Services, and Rich Uribe, Coordinator of Special Services
items.item_text_raw: 10.01 Special Education Compliance and Oversight Plan Progress Presentation - Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction, Carole Hersom, Coordinator of Special Services, and Rich Uribe, Coordinator of Special Services

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  10.02
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction, and Kirsten King, Director of Instructional Services
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Approve CAHSEE Local Waivers for Special Education Students
	 
DESCRIPTION:  
Education Code Section 60851 states that students who take one or both parts of the CAHSEE with a modification and receive the equivalent of a passing score are eligible for the waiver request process.  At the request of the student's parent or guardian, a school principal must submit to the local school governing board a request for a waiver of the requirement to pass the part(s) of the CASHEE on which a modification was used and the equivalent of a passing score was earned.  For the local board to waive the CASHEE requirement, the principal must certify to the local board that the pupil has all of the following:
An individualized education program adopted pursuant to the federal Individuals with Disabilities Education Act or a plan adopted pursuant to Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 that requires the accommodations or modifications to be provided to the pupil when taking the high school exit examination.
Sufficient high school level coursework either satisfactorily completed or in progress in a high school level curriculum sufficient to have attained the skills and knowledge otherwise needed to pass the high school exit examination.
An individual score report for the pupil showing that the pupil has received the equivalent of a passing score on the high school exit examination measures as determined by the State Board of Education.
The waivers were requested by the school site administration on behalf of the students' parents.
	 
The recommended waivers meet the aforementioned criteria delineated in the Education Code 60851:
Student A
Student B
Student C
Student D
Student E
Student F
Student G
Student H
Student I
Student J
Student K 
Student L
Student M
Student N
Student O
Student P
Student Q
Student R
Student S
Student T
				 
				 
				 
				 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT
N/A
	 
FUNDING SOURCE
N/A
	 
RECOMMENDATION
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the recommended waivers.
items.item_text: Approve CAHSEE Local Waivers for Special Education Students - Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction
items.item_text_raw: 10.02 Approve CAHSEE Local Waivers for Special Education Students - Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction

items.item_details:
Item:  10.03
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction, and Kirsten King, Director of Instructional Services
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Review of Current Grading Policy for Discussion and/or Action
	 
Grading Policy Update
	 
East Side Union High School District Grading Policies are found within many different board policies. The main policies that contain references to grading are (see attached for actual policies):
6155.1 Grades/Evaluation of Student Achievement
5120.1 Assignment of Credit
5113    Absences and Excuses
6154    Homework/Makeup work
5121    Grades Evaluation of Student Achievement
5126    Awards of Achievement
The Parent Handbook contains a compilation reference of most of the grading policies (see attached).
	 
All of the grading policies referenced in board policy were brought to the Instructional Policies Committee (IPC) in the Fall of 2010 as a discussion item. The IPC found that it would be beneficial to add one comprehensive board policy that stated all references to grading while keeping the current references to grading in existing board policy. They also recommended that some additional clarity added to existing policy would be beneficial to teachers, parents, students, and administrators.
	 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT
N/A
	 
FUNDING SOURCE
N/A
	 
RECOMMENDATION
The administration recommends the board to direct the administration to consolidate all grading policy references in existing board policy into one cohesive board policy while keeping existing policy in place and to add clarity to existing policy. The new policy should be taken to the Instructional Policy Committee in October of 2011 and upon their approval brought to the board for a first read in December of 2011.

meeting_sections.section_name: INSTRUCTIONAL SERVICES/STUDENT SERVICES - OPERATIONAL ITEMS/BOARD DISCUSSION AND/OR ACTION

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  11.01
	 
	 
TO:                               Board of Trustees
	 
FROM:                          Dan Moser, Superintendent
	 
PREPARED BY:            Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction
	 
SUBJECT:                    Approve Declaration of Need for Fully Qualified Educators
	 
	 
In July 1994, the Commission on Teacher Credentialing changed the process for emergency credentialing.  Prior to that time, districts were required to issue individual statements of need for each applicant.  The applicant, in turn, would take the declaration of need to the county office of education for the issuance of an emergency credential. This applies to the following credentials or authorizations: Emergency CLAD, BCLAD, Resource Specialist, Library Media, Clinical or Rehabilitative Permits.
	 
Now, the Commission issues a permit to an individual who qualifies for an emergency based on the district’s Declaration of Need.  This Declaration, approved by the local Board of Trustees, is submitted to the Commission once a year.  
	 
Emergency permits, although originally used primarily to staff partial assignments and special education, now help fill the fully credentialed teacher gap created by class size reduction and statewide teacher shortage.  Every attempt is being made to hire credentialed teachers before considering people on emergency permits.  
	 
Attached is the Commission on Teacher Credentialing form titled Declaration of Need for Fully Qualified Educators.  Pursuant to direction from the county office of education’s credential’s office, the district is over estimating the number of permits it might require in order to cover any unanticipated needs that might occur during the course of the 2011-2012 school year.
	 
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
As per salary schedule
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
General, Special Education and Adult Education funds
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the Declaration of Need for Fully Qualified Educators.
items.item_text: Approve Declaration of Need for Fully Qualified Educators - Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  14.05
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Approve Permanent Course Adoption for Expository Reading and Writing
	 
	 
The Instructional Policies Committee (IPC) has reviewed the Expository Reading and Writing course.  This course was piloted during the 2010-2011 school year.  The course description is included for your review.
	 
The goal of the Expository Reading and Writing Course is to prepare college-bound seniors for the literacy demands of higher education.  Through a sequence of fourteen rigorous instructional modules, students in the year long rhetoric-based course develop advanced proficiency in expository, analytical, and argumentative reading and writing.  The cornerstone of the course-the assignment template-presents a process for helping students read, comprehend, and respond to nonfiction and literary texts.  Modules also provide instruction in research methods and documentation conventions.  Students will be expected to increase their awareness of the rhetorical strategies employed by authors and to apply those strategies in their own writing.  They will read closely to examine the relationship between an author's argument or theme and his or her audience and purpose; to analyze the impact of structural and rhetorical strategies; and to examine the social, political, and philosophical assumptions that underlie the text.  By the end of the course, students will be expected to use this process independently when reading unfamiliar texts and writing in response to them.  Course texts include contemporary essays, newspaper and magazine articles, editorials, reports, biographies, memos, assorted public documents, and other nonfiction texts.  The course materials also include modules on two full-length works (one novel and one work of nonfiction).  Written assessment and holistic scoring guides conclude each unit.
	 
FISCAL IMPACT
N/A
	 
FUNDING SOURCE
N/A
	 
RECOMMENDATION
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve above course.
items.item_text: Approve Permanent Course Adoption for Expository Reading and Writing

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
			 
Item:  14.13
TO:
Board of Trustees
						 
						 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Superintendent
						 
						 
PREPARED BY:
Hardy Childers, Interim Associate Superintendent of Business Services
						 
						 
SUBJECT:
Accept Warrant Register for the Month of April 2011
			 
			 
Attached is a list of warrants issued during the month of April 2011, in response to board Policy 3314 Payment for Goods and Services adopted by the board in May 2009.  The Policy states that, “The Board shall approve all warrants (checks) at a regularly scheduled Board meeting".  While there is no legal requirement for Board approval of issued warrants, this list and future lists will add to the “transparency” of when the Board approves purchase orders, contracts and other authorized expenses as per Board Policies.
			 
			 
FISCAL IMPACT:
Not Applicable
			 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Not Applicable
			 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees accept the Warrant Register for the month of April 2011.
